definition: stingy (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao
(negative prefix)/not/no
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: Chinese consumers “won’t pay a penny” for recorded music, says Gary Chen.
sentences.chinese: 中國的消費者對於正版音樂“一毛不拔”，陳戈說。
這傢伙是個一毛不拔的人。

sentences.english: Her boss is stingy with money.
sentences.chinese: 她的老闆是一個一毛不拔的人。

sentences.english: Sheila's dad is a real tight wad.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的父親真是個一毛不拔的鐵公雞。

sentences.english: A cotton wad that was impregnated with ether.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的父親真是個一毛不拔的鐵公雞。

sentences.english: An iron rooster in Chinese means miserly.
sentences.chinese: 鐵公雞在漢語中的意思是一毛不拔。
他們都是些一毛不拔的人。
她老闆是個一毛不拔的人。
這樣一毛不拔的吝嗇鬼世上少見。

sentences.english: Rich as he is, he never gives anybody anything.
sentences.chinese: 他儘管有錢，可是從來一毛不拔。

sentences.english: Mr. Lee, a close-fisted man, never wants to donate anything for charity.
sentences.chinese: 一毛不拔的李先生，從來不爲公益樂捐。
他老闆是個一毛不拔的人。
我老闆是個一毛不拔的人。
她老闆是個一毛不拔的人。

definition: cheapskate/stingy person
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
(dialect) stingy
stingy/miserly/narrow-minded/petty
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
miser/penny-pincher
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
spendthrift/wastrel/prodigal
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
to be greedy in getting money
stingy/mean/miserly
miser/scrooge
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5
